subNodes.conversationText: root

You have reached the tip of the great lake, Asan. Far in the distance you can just about make out the mountains that mark the northern shores of the lake. You know that there is a fishing village called Perth at the base of those mountains. If you had a boat, you could row there in half a day.
Continue

Behind you, there is the rasp of quickly drawn steel. 

"Get off me!"
Continue.
"I did not touch you, Bounty Hunter. I have no taste for you. And little need."
"What's going on here?"

Anu's eyes are cold. "A misunderstanding, I am sure."

She sheathes her blade and moves carefully away from Bathak, who watches her emotionlessly.
[speak to Bathak]
Bathak watches your approach without much apparent interest. "Yes?"
"What happened?"
Bathak glowers at you. "The Bountry Hunter is easily startled. There is nothing more to it."
"Its not like Anu to react like that. Tell me what happened?"
"I cannot explain her actions. You would need to speak to her."
[Speak to Anu]
Anu shakes her head as you approach. "You keep bad company, <FullName>. That... thing is no man."
"Bathak? He's a bit weird, but he's okay."
"You are a fool, if you think that. Have you not seen how he looks at us? How he looks at you? Whatever he thinks of us, we're not his friends. Keep that in mind if you want to survive this day."
"What actually happened?"
She shrugs. "He's your friend, apparently. Ask him." She walks away, abruptly ending the conversation.
Continue.
"I'll keep an eye on him. Did he touch you?"
Anu shudders. "No... well, not with his hands. I don't know..." She pauses. "Just watch out for that one. There is something very wrong about him."
"Okay, I'll keep that in mind."
Anu nods. "You are a sensible leader. Know that I have your back."
"Thank you. Lets get going."
"Ah, you're just jumping at shadows. I expected more from you, to be honest."
"You are a fool, if you think that. Have you not seen how he looks at us? How he looks at you? Whatever he thinks of us, we're not his friends. Keep that in mind if you want to survive this day."
"Fine. Let's move on."
[Move on]
[Speak to Anu]
Anu shakes her head as you approach. "You keep bad company, <FullName>. That... thing is no man."
"Bathak? He's a bit weird, but he's okay."
"You are a fool, if you think that. Have you not seen how he looks at us? How he looks at you? Whatever he thinks of us, we're not his friends. Keep that in mind if you want to survive this day."
"What actually happened?"
She shrugs. "He's your friend, apparently. Ask him." She walks away, abruptly ending the conversation.
Continue.
"I'll keep an eye on him. Did he touch you?"
Anu shudders. "No... well, not with his hands. I don't know..." She pauses. "Just watch out for that one. There is something very wrong about him."
"Okay, I'll keep that in mind."
Anu nods. "You are a sensible leader. Know that I have your back."
"Thank you. Lets get going."
"Ah, you're just jumping at shadows. I expected more from you, to be honest."
"You are a fool, if you think that. Have you not seen how he looks at us? How he looks at you? Whatever he thinks of us, we're not his friends. Keep that in mind if you want to survive this day."
"Fine. Let's move on."
[Move on]
"We haven't got time for this."
Bathak glowers at you. "I agree."
Time to move on.

You have reached the tip of the great lake, Asan. Far in the distance you can just about make out the mountains that mark the northern shores of the lake. You know that there is a fishing village called Perth at the base of those mountains. If you had a boat, you could row there in half a day.
Continue
"The fishermen will not come this far out. We cannot attact their attention from here."
"We could light a fire?"
"The forest is very dry. A fire would be foolish. And the Raventhal would not forget such a deed."
"You could just have said no."
You have reached the tip of the great lake, Asan.
Continue.
